newsitem.title: CUBA: Cuba to close old copper mine, start new one.
newsitem.headline: Cuba to close old copper mine, start new one.

text.p: Cuban authorities are closing down an 83-year-old copper mine in western Cuba, because it is no longer economically viable, but a new, potentially more productive copper deposit will be developed nearby, state media reported Tuesday.

State radio and the official newspaper Granma said the Matahambre copper mine in Pinar del Rio province was ceasing production "because its reserves for economically viable exploitation have run out".

Cuba's Basic Industry Minister Marcos Portal was quoted as saying that 30 miles (50 km) from Matahambre, also in Pinar del Rio province, another copper deposit was being developed "which will multiply the productivity of Matahambre by 15 times."
The new mine "will be developed as an open-cast site, at a low cost and high profitability," the minister added.

He was referring to the Mantua mine, a large copper deposit with a gold cap, which is being developed through a joint venture involving Canada's Northern Orion Explorations Ltd, a subsidiary of Vancouver-based Miramar Mining Corp.
Cuban media said that well over half of the 623 workers at the Matahambre mine would be relocated to other jobs. Others would be retired.
